intro: Siphocodon, commonly known as the rock cress, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Brassicaceae. These plants are typically small, herbaceous perennials that thrive in rocky or gravelly soils. They are characterized by their basal rosettes of leaves and small, cruciform flowers that bloom in early spring. Siphocodon species are often found in arid or semi-arid regions, showcasing adaptations to harsh environmental conditions. Their ecological importance includes providing nectar for pollinators and stabilizing soil in rocky habitats.
